Class Scanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • Scanner

  • public class Scanner
extends java.lang.Object
    Scanner is a simple scanner for Compilers and Interpreters (2014-2015) lab exercise 1
    Version:
    082914 implemented getNextChar Usage:
    Author:
    Sadhika Malladi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Scanner(java.io.InputStream inStream)
      Scanner constructor for construction of a scanner that uses an InputStream object for input.
      Scanner(java.lang.String inString)
      Scanner constructor for constructing a scanner that scans a given input string.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void getNextChar()
      Method: getNextChar Usage: private method - getNextChar() -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Sets instance field currentChar to value read using input stream 'read' method input stream 'read' method returns -1 when at end of line, this is used to set eof instance variable.
      boolean hasNext()
      Method: hasNext Usage: public method - Scanner.hasNext() -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- determines if input is at the end of the file using instance variable eof

      Method: isDigit Usage: Scanner.isDigit(char digit) --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- checks to see if the input char, param digit, is defined in the regular expression [0-9].

      Method: isLetter Usage: Scanner.isLetter(char letter) ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- checks to see if the input char, param letter, is defined in the regular expression [a-zA-Z]

      Method: isWhitespace Usage: Scanner.isWhitespace(char testchar) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- checks to see if the input char, param testchar, is one of the following: 1.
      java.lang.String nextToken()
      Method: nextToken Usage: Scanner.nextToken() -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- looks ahead one character and decides to scan number, identifier, or operand based on currentChar type.
      void runDiagnosticsStep1()
      Method: runDiagnosticsStep1 Usage: Scanner.runDiagnosticsStep1() ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- this public method is useful for testing Scanner methods getNextChar and eat.
      void runDiagnosticsStep2()
      Method: runDiagnosticsStep2 Usage: Scanner.runDiagnosticsStep2() -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- tests the ability to recognize digits, letters, and whitespace.
      void runDiagnosticsStep3()
      Method: runDiagnosticsStep3 Usage: Scanner.runDiagnosticsStep3() ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ tests the nextToken method and all of its helper methods: scanNumber, scanIdentifier, and scanOperand prints out each token on a new line

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scanner

        public Scanner(java.io.InputStream inStream)
        Scanner constructor for construction of a scanner that uses an InputStream object for input. Usage: FileInputStream inStream = new FileInputStream(new File(); Scanner lex = new Scanner(inStream);
        Parameters:
        inStream - the input stream to use

      • Scanner

        public Scanner(java.lang.String inString)
        Scanner constructor for constructing a scanner that scans a given input string. It sets the end-of-file flag an then reads the first character of the input string into the instance field currentChar. Usage: Scanner lex = new Scanner(input_string);
        Parameters:
        inString - the string to scan

    • Method Detail

      • getNextChar

        public void getNextChar()
        Method: getNextChar Usage: private method - getNextChar() -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Sets instance field currentChar to value read using input stream 'read' method input stream 'read' method returns -1 when at end of line, this is used to set eof instance variable. if an IO exception is thrown then the system exits with a status of 1 and the stack trace is printed.

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Method: hasNext Usage: public method - Scanner.hasNext() -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- determines if input is at the end of the file using instance variable eof
        Returns:
        true if input stream is not at the end of the file; otherwise, false.

      • nextToken

        public java.lang.String nextToken()
                           throws ScanErrorException
        Method: nextToken Usage: Scanner.nextToken() -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- looks ahead one character and decides to scan number, identifier, or operand based on currentChar type.
        Returns:
        the next token: a number, identifier, or operand.
        Throws:
        ScanErrorException

      • isDigit

        public static boolean isDigit(char digit)
        Method: isDigit Usage: Scanner.isDigit(char digit) --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- checks to see if the input char, param digit, is defined in the regular expression [0-9].
        Parameters:
        digit - a char to be checked
        Returns:
        true if parameter digit is included in [0-9]; otherwise, false.

      • isLetter

        public static boolean isLetter(char letter)
        Method: isLetter Usage: Scanner.isLetter(char letter) ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- checks to see if the input char, param letter, is defined in the regular expression [a-zA-Z]
        Parameters:
        letter - a char to be checked
        true - if the input char is a letter defined by the regular expression [a-zA-Z].

      • isWhitespace

        public static boolean isWhitespace(char testchar)
        Method: isWhitespace Usage: Scanner.isWhitespace(char testchar) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- checks to see if the input char, param testchar, is one of the following: 1. ' ' 2. tab or new line escape sequence 3. carriage return escape sequence
        Parameters:
        testchar - the character to be tested as whitespace
        Returns:
        true if testchar is whitespace, otherwise, false.

      • runDiagnosticsStep1

        public void runDiagnosticsStep1()
                         throws ScanErrorException
        Method: runDiagnosticsStep1 Usage: Scanner.runDiagnosticsStep1() ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- this public method is useful for testing Scanner methods getNextChar and eat. the first 3 letters of the input file will be printed to the console
        Throws:
        ScanErrorException - if getNextChar failed to retrieve the correct character and/or eat failed to recognize the match

      • runDiagnosticsStep2

        public void runDiagnosticsStep2()
                         throws ScanErrorException
        Method: runDiagnosticsStep2 Usage: Scanner.runDiagnosticsStep2() -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- tests the ability to recognize digits, letters, and whitespace. user must verify that presented strings are in fact what the Scanner believes they are.
        Throws:
        ScanErrorException - if getNextChar or eat are broken

      • runDiagnosticsStep3

        public void runDiagnosticsStep3()
                         throws ScanErrorException
        Method: runDiagnosticsStep3 Usage: Scanner.runDiagnosticsStep3() ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ tests the nextToken method and all of its helper methods: scanNumber, scanIdentifier, and scanOperand prints out each token on a new line
        Throws:
        ScanErrorException - if some token is not recognized
